trans-unit.source: Represents a claim for a <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlSecurityToken"></xref> security token that asserts that the subject was authenticated by a particular means at a particular time.
<xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlSecurityToken> security tokens specify their claims using SAML assertions, which can specify when the subject was authenticated.
The claims in a SAML assertion are represented by SAML statements.
The SAML specification defines a set of SAML statement types and one of them is a SamlAuthenticationStatement.
A SamlAuthenticationStatement asserts that the statement's subject was authenticated by a particular means at a particular time.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlAuthenticationStatement"></xref> class.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlAuthenticationStatement"></xref> class using the specified authentication details.
The set of authentication methods is extensible; however the following table contains the set of authentication methods defined in the SAML specification.

|Authentication method|URI| |---------------------------|---------| |Password|urn:oasis:names:tc:SAML:1.0:am:password| |Kerberos|urn:ietf:rfc:1510| |Secure Remote Password (SRP)|urn:ietf:rfc:2945| |Hardware Token|URI:urn:oasis:names:tc:SAML:1.0:am:HardwareToken| |SSL/TLS Certificate Based Client Authentication|urn:ietf:rfc:2246| |PGP Public Key|urn:oasis:names:tc:SAML:1.0:am:PGP| |SPKI Public Key|urn:oasis:names:tc:SAML:1.0:am:SPKI| |XKMS Public Key|urn:oasis:names:tc:SAML:1.0:am:XKMS| |XML Digital Signature|urn:ietf:rfc:3075| |Unspecified|urn:oasis:names:tc:SAML:1.0:am:unspecified| When the `authenticationMethod` parameter is `null`, the authentication method is set to `urn:oasis:names:tc:SAML:1.0:am:unspecified`.
A <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlSubject"></xref> that represents the subject of the claim.
A URI reference that specifies how the subject was authenticated.
A <xref:System.DateTime> that specifies the instant in time at which the subject was authenticated.
The DNS domain name in which the computer that authenticated the subject resides.
The IP address of the computer that authenticated the subject.
An <xref:System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable%601> of type <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlAuthorityBinding"></xref> that contains additional information about the subject.
authorityBindings contains a member that is .
Adds a claim based on the properties of this instance to the specified collection of claims.

The AddClaimsToList method adds a claim to the `claims` parameter based on the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlAuthenticationStatement.AuthenticationInstant%2A>, <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlAuthenticationStatement.AuthenticationMethod%2A>, <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlAuthenticationStatement.AuthorityBindings%2A>, <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlAuthenticationStatement.ClaimType%2A>, <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlAuthenticationStatement.DnsAddress%2A>, <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlAuthenticationStatement.IPAddress%2A>, and properties.
An <xref:System.Collections.Generic.IList%601> of type <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Claims.Claim"></xref> that contains the set of claims to add to.
claims is .
Gets or sets the instant in time at which the subject was authenticated.
The time is stored in Coordinated Universal Time (UTC).

The AuthenticationInstant property corresponds to the `AuthenticationInstant` attribute of the `<AuthenticationStatement>` element that is defined in the Assertions and Protocol for the OASIS Security Assertion Markup Language (SAML) specification.
A <xref:System.DateTime> that specifies the instant in time at which the subject was authenticated.
Exception type
Condition
<xref:System.InvalidOperationException>
The AuthenticationInstant property is set and the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlAuthenticationStatement.IsReadOnly*> property is <xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref>.
Gets or sets the method used to authenticate the subject.
The set of authentication methods is extensible; however the following table contains the set of authentication methods defined in the SAML specification.

|Authentication method|URI| |---------------------------|---------| |Password|urn:oasis:names:tc:SAML:1.0:am:password| |Kerberos|urn:ietf:rfc:1510| |Secure Remote Password (SRP)|urn:ietf:rfc:2945| |Hardware Token|URI:urn:oasis:names:tc:SAML:1.0:am:HardwareToken| |SSL/TLS Certificate Based Client Authentication|urn:ietf:rfc:2246| |PGP Public Key|urn:oasis:names:tc:SAML:1.0:am:PGP| |SPKI Public Key|urn:oasis:names:tc:SAML:1.0:am:SPKI| |XKMS Public Key|urn:oasis:names:tc:SAML:1.0:am:XKMS| |XML Digital Signature|urn:ietf:rfc:3075| |Unspecified|urn:oasis:names:tc:SAML:1.0:am:unspecified| When the AuthenticationMethod property is set to `null`, the authentication method is set to `urn:oasis:names:tc:SAML:1.0:am:unspecified`.

The AuthenticationMethod property corresponds to the `AuthenticationMethod` attribute of the `<AuthenticationStatement>` element that is defined in the Assertions and Protocol for the OASIS Security Assertion Markup Language (SAML) specification.
The method used to authenticate the subject.
The default value is <xref uid="langword_csharp_urn:oasis:names:tc:SAML:1.0:am:unspecified" name="urn:oasis:names:tc:SAML:1.0:am:unspecified" href=""></xref>.
The AuthenticationMethod property is set and the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlAuthenticationStatement.IsReadOnly*> property is <xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref>.
Gets additional information about the subject.

The AuthorityBindings property corresponds to a set of `<AuthorityBinding>` child elements for an `<AuthenticationStatement>` element that is defined in the Assertions and Protocol for the OASIS Security Assertion Markup Language (SAML) specification.
An <xref:System.Collections.Generic.IList%601> of type <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlAuthorityBinding"></xref> that contains additional information about the subject.
Gets the type of security claim.
A <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Claims.ClaimTypes"></xref> that specifies the type of security claim.
Always `http://schemas.microsoft.com/mb/2005/09/ClaimType/SamlAuthentication`.
Gets or sets the DNS domain name in which the computer that authenticated the subject resides.

The DnsAddress property corresponds to the `DNSAddress` attribute of the `<SubjectLocality>` element that is defined in the Assertions and Protocol for the OASIS Security Assertion Markup Language (SAML) specification.
The DNS domain name in which the computer that authenticated the subject resides.
The DnsAddress property is set and the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlAuthenticationStatement.IsReadOnly*> property is <xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref>.
Gets or sets the IP address of the computer that authenticated the subject.

The IPAddress property corresponds to the `IPAddress` attribute of the `<SubjectLocality>` element that is defined in the Assertions and Protocol for the OASIS Security Assertion Markup Language (SAML) specification.
The IP address of the computer that authenticated the subject.
Gets a value that indicates whether the properties of this instance are read-only.

To make this instance of the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlAuthenticationStatement> class read-only, call the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlAuthenticationStatement.MakeReadOnly%2A> method.
<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> if the properties of this instance are read-only; otherwise, <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
The default is <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
Causes this instance to be read-only.

When the MakeReadOnly method is called, the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlAuthenticationStatement.IsReadOnly%2A> property is set to `true` and properties of this instance can no longer be set.
Reads the SAML authentication statement from the specified XML reader.

The ReadXml method sets the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlAuthenticationStatement.AuthenticationInstant%2A>, <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlAuthenticationStatement.AuthenticationMethod%2A>, <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlAuthenticationStatement.AuthorityBindings%2A>, <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlAuthenticationStatement.DnsAddress%2A>, <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlAuthenticationStatement.IPAddress%2A>, and properties.
A <xref:System.Xml.XmlDictionaryReader> to read the SAML authentication statement.
A <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlSerializer"></xref> that is capable of reading XML elements in the SAML authentication statement that is defined in the SAML specification.
A <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Selectors.SecurityTokenSerializer"></xref> that reads the <xref uid="langword_csharp_KeyInfo" name="KeyInfo" href=""></xref> clause of the digital signature.
A <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Selectors.SecurityTokenResolver"></xref> that determines the security token that created the digital signature.
reader is -or- samlSerializer is
reader refers to an XML element that does not contain the and attributes.
-or- reader refers to an XML element that does not have a child element.
Writes the SAML authentication statement into the specified XML serializer.
A <xref:System.Xml.XmlDictionaryWriter> to write the SAML authentication statement.
A <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlSerializer"></xref> that is capable of writing XML elements in a SAML assertion.
A <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Selectors.SecurityTokenSerializer"></xref> that is capable of writing <xref uid="langword_csharp_KeyInfo" name="KeyInfo" href=""></xref> clauses.
writer is -or- samlSerializer is .
